variants.Description in input context: G2019S variant in LRRK2 associated with Parkinson's disease
R478W variant in LRRK2 linked to Parkinson's disease

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells were transfected with LRRK2 variants (G2019S, R478W) and wild-type controls.

Readout description.Result Description: Protein expression of G2019S variant showed 30% reduction compared to wild-type.
R478W variant exhibited 20% increased kinase activity in vitro.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed for each variant.

Technical replicates.Description: Each blot was repeated in triplicate for technical validation.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 cDNA was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected cells served as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: t-test was used to compare variant vs. wild-type groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression â‰¥ 85% of wild-type control

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein expression < 70% of wild-type control or kinase activity > 25% increase

Material used.Description: Recombinant LRRK2 variants (G2019S, R478W) were tested in kinase assays with ATP and substrate.

Readout description.Result Description: G2019S variant showed 40% reduced kinase activity compared to wild-type.
R478W variant exhibited 60% increased kinase activity compared to wild-type.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent kinase reactions were performed per variant.

Technical replicates.Description: Each reaction was repeated in duplicate for technical consistency.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 protein was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: No enzyme (buffer only) was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used to compare kinase activity across variants.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Kinase activity within 10-15% of wild-type range

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Kinase activity < 5% or > 30% deviation from wild-type
